title: How to connect my phone to my projector with HDMI - Quora

response.answer_text: Both your phone and your projector needs to support MHL (Mobile High-Definition Link), check their manuals or tech specs (usually TVs and Projectors that are compatible will have a special HDMI port for MHL connection so make sure you connect to that specific port), then, just buy a micro-usb to HDMI cable and hook it right up. If one or two of the devices don’t support MHL, you’re gonna need to stream it via Wi-fi, some newer projectors already have wi-fi and Intel’s WiDi/Miracast built in so you can stream right up to it from your phone, just enable those features in the projector’s menu. And then choose “connect” on your phone. Others will need a something like a Chromecast so you can stream your phone’s screen to it.

To connect the Mobile Projector to a device using an HDMI cable or MHL cable, follow the steps below. Connect the supplied HDMI to Mini HDMI converter adapter to the HDMI/MHL IN jack of the Mobile Projector.Turn on the mobile projector.Press the Jog lever while at the ENTER position.
